context_bundle.summary: Bun all-in-one JavaScript runtime with built-in bundler, test runner, package manager, and Node.js compatibility for fast development workflows

onboarding.quick_start: curl -fsSL https://bun.sh/install | bash && bun --version && bun init && bun install && bun run index.ts
common_patterns: Run TypeScript: 'bun run index.ts' - no compilation needed, runs TypeScript directly
HTTP server: 'Bun.serve({ port: 3000, fetch(req) { return new Response("Hello World"); } });'
Testing: 'import { test, expect } from "bun:test"; test("addition", () => { expect(1 + 1).toBe(2); });'
File I/O: 'const file = Bun.file("./data.txt"); const text = await file.text(); await Bun.write("output.txt", text);'
SQLite: 'import { Database } from "bun:sqlite"; const db = new Database("mydb.sqlite"); db.run("CREATE TABLE users (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT)");'
Bundling: 'await Bun.build({ entrypoints: ["./index.ts"], outdir: "./dist", minify: true });'
Package manager: 'bun add express' for installing, 'bun install' for lockfile, 'bun update' for updates
Environment: 'const apiKey = Bun.env.API_KEY;' for environment variables
known_errors: Module not found: Run 'bun install' to install dependencies, check import paths
Native module incompatible: Some Node.js native modules don't work, use Bun-compatible alternatives
Test not found: Ensure test files end with .test.ts or .spec.ts, use 'bun test' to run
Build failed: Check for syntax errors, ensure all imports are resolvable
SQLite error: Install bun with 'bun upgrade' for latest SQLite support
Performance regression: Profile with 'bun --inspect', check for blocking operations
